title: Harry Gifford
text:
Henry "Harry" Gifford (1884 – 1952) was an English professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1900s, 1910s and 1920s. He played at representative level for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a>, <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> and <a href="Rugby%20League%20War%20of%20the%20Roses">Lancashire</a>, and at club level for <a href="Ulverston%20A.R.L.F.C.">Ulverston</a> <a href="Ulverston%20Hornets%20ARLFC">Hornets ARLFC</a><a href="https%3A//web.archive.org/web/20120926114631/http%3A//www.ulverston-rugby.co.uk/"></a>, and <a href="Barrow%20Raiders">Barrow</a>, initially in the <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Backs">backs</a>; as a (182-appearances), (65-appearances), (54-appearances), or / (25-appearances), i.e. number 1, 2 or 5, 3 or 4, 6, or 7, and latterly in the <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Forwards">forwards</a> (non-specific forward 21-appearances, prior to the specialist positions of; ), and (25-appearances), (6-appearances), (6-appearances), or (39-appearances), during the era of contested <a href="Scrum%20%28rugby%29%23Rugby%20league">scrum</a>s.
Background.
Harry Gifford was born in <a href="Kirkby-in-Furness">Kirkby-in-Furness</a>, <a href="Lancashire">Lancashire</a>, England, and his death aged 67 was registered in <a href="Ulverston">Ulverston</a> district, <a href="Lancashire">Lancashire</a>, England.
Playing career.
International honours.
Harry Gifford won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> while at Barrow in 1908 against Wales, in 1909 against Australia (3 matches), and won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> while at Barrow in 1908-9 against Australia (2 matches).
County honours.
Harry Gifford won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="Rugby%20League%20War%20of%20the%20Roses">Lancashire</a> while at Barrow.
Club career.
Harry Gifford was transferred from Ulverston Hornets to Barrow during August 1901 for one <a href="guinea%20%28British%20coin%29">guinea</a>, i.e. one <a href="pound%20%28currency%29">pound</a>, and one <a href="shilling">shilling</a> (based on increases in average earnings, this would be approximately £400.10 in 2017), he played his last match for Barrow in the 4-52 defeat by <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> at <a href="Central%20Park%20%28Wigan%29">Central Park</a>, <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a> on Saturday 21 October 1922.
Honoured at Barrow Raiders.
Harry Gifford is a Barrow Raiders Hall of Fame inductee, his commemorative plaque is displayed in the Barrow Raiders boardroom.
